thread.title: Snowfall warnings in effect for Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley Vancouver
thread.title_full: Snowfall warnings in effect for Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley | CTV Vancouver News

author: The Canadian Press
title: Snowfall warnings in effect for Metro Vancouver, Fraser Valley Vancouver
text:
Wicked mid-winter weather continues grip large parts of southern B.C. with snowfall warnings posted from Victoria all the way east to the Elk Valley where Environment Canada says as much as 40 centimetres is forecast by the end of the day.
About two to four centimetres is expected over Vancouver on Monday while Victoria will also see accumulations through today and into tomorrow.
At least 10 centimetres is due in the Fraser Valley -- where 80 centimetres has blanketed the Chilliwack region since Friday.
All the snow has forced closures of public schools in Surrey, Maple Ridge, Pitt Meadows, Langley, Mission, Abbotsford and Chilliwack, as well as campuses of the University of the Fraser Valley, while buses in the Southeast Kootenay School District are not running but schools are open.
Snowfall records across southern British Columbia are falling as a winter storm continues to wallop the region.
Environment Canada meteorologist Jennifer Hay says a new high was set at Vancouver's airport Friday, when 12 centimetres fell, beating the record of 10.7 centimetres set in 1946.
In Abbotsford, 20 centimetres fell Saturday, demolishing 1957's tally of 7.6 centimetres.
